config.question: Which action by Secretary of the Interior Ballinger did Chief Forester Pinchot seize upon when he asked Taft to intervene in a growing controversy?

choices.content: the sale of Alaskan coal lands to a syndicate
easing restrictions on logging activities in the Northwest
the sale of mining leases in West Virginia
the withdrawal of laws banning unrestricted hunting

answer_3.response: Seizing on a report that Ballinger had helped sell Alaskan coal lands to a syndicate that included J. P. Morgan, Pinchot asked Taft to intervene. After investigating, Taft supported Ballinger, although he asked Pinchot to remain in office.
